column1: Diastasis recti is common in newborns.
Pregnant women may develop the condition because of increased tension on the abdominal wall.
Diastasis recti is commonly seen in women who have multiple pregnancies.
Extra skin and soft tissue in the front of the abdominal wall may be the only signs of this condition in early pregnancy.
No treatment is needed for pregnant women with this condition.
Surgery may be needed if the baby develops a hernia that becomes trapped in the space between the muscles.
Surgery is rarely performed for diastasis recti.
